overview.description: Kerala, located on India's southwestern coast, is known for its backwaters, spice plantations, and Ayurvedic heritage. Established as a state on November 1, 1956, it features attractions like Kochi and Munnar.

top_destinations.name: Kochi
top_destinations.description: A historic port city with Chinese fishing nets and Fort Kochi.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Explore Mattancherry Palace; try a backwater cruise.

top_destinations.name: Munnar
top_destinations.description: A hill station known for tea plantations and Eravikulam National Park.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit tea estates; carry warm clothes.

top_destinations.name: Alleppey
top_destinations.description: Famous for its backwaters and houseboat experiences.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Book a houseboat in advance; visit the beach.

culinary_delights.name: Dhe Puttu
culinary_delights.description: Known for puttu and kadala curry.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: The Rice Boat
culinary_delights.description: Offers a variety of Kerala specialties.

must_visit_spots.name: Backwaters of Alleppey
must_visit_spots.description: Serene waterways ideal for houseboat cruises.
must_visit_spots.tip: Book a sunset cruise for the best experience.

must_visit_spots.name: Tea Plantations of Munnar
must_visit_spots.description: Lush green hills with tea gardens.
must_visit_spots.tip: Visit a tea factory for a tour.

must_visit_spots.name: Fort Kochi
must_visit_spots.description: A historic area with colonial charm.

must_visit_spots.name: Varkala Beach
must_visit_spots.description: A cliff-lined beach with spiritual significance.

must_visit_spots.name: Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary
must_visit_spots.description: Home to tigers, elephants, and a scenic lake.
must_visit_spots.tip: Take a boat ride for wildlife spotting.

must_visit_spots.name: Wayanad
must_visit_spots.description: Known for waterfalls and spice plantations.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Kochi is 600 km from Bengaluru (NH544, 12-14 hrs). By train: Ernakulam Junction connects major cities. By air: Cochin International Airport (Kochi).
travel_essentials.tips: Carry light clothing; book houseboats in advance.
